context: Task asks to 'add R to readme' in the posthog-go repository. This likely refers to adding a reference to the Ruby SDK (posthog-ruby) to the README, but the exact scope, placement, and format are unclear. The README currently contains only Go-specific content with no cross-references to other PostHog SDKs.
blockers: Task description is ambiguous - 'R' could theoretically mean Ruby SDK, R programming language support, or something else entirely
Unclear whether to add only Ruby or create a comprehensive multi-SDK reference section
No specification of where in README or what format the addition should take
No established pattern in the codebase for how other SDKs should be referenced

questions.question: What is the scope of SDK references to add?
options: Add only Ruby (posthog-ruby) with a single reference/link
Create a 'Other PostHog SDKs' section listing all major server-side SDKs (Ruby, Python, Node.js, PHP, Java, C#)
Add a minimal 'See Also' section at the end with link to the central SDK comparison page

questions.question: Where should the Ruby/SDK reference be placed in the README?
options: In the introduction/header section, near 'Please see the main PostHog docs'
New dedicated section after 'Development' and before 'Examples'
At the end after 'Questions?' as a footer reference

questions.question: What format should the reference use?
options: Simple bulleted list with GitHub repository links
Structured table showing SDK name, language, and link
Inline text mentioning Ruby with a hyperlink in existing documentation section
